stories.text:
Hello HN, Pablo here from Appfluence. DelayedSend (https://delayedsend.com) is an add-in to schedule messages in Microsoft Teams. You can choose the time, the destination chat (personal or group), and of course the message itself. There is a dashboard to reschedule, edit, or cancel messages if you change your mind.

We built this because we work with both Slack and Teams, and we noticed the big convenience gap between the two, with delayed/scheduled messages being one of the most glaring ones.

On the technical side, the app was built in less than a month, on Azure App Service with NextJS, which was also a fun way to learn something new for some of us.

The app is completely free, since it's a bit of a side project for now, but we expect to add some premium features in the future, such as recurrence, rich formats, delivery alerts, etc.

I'd love your feedback! Happy to answer any questions.
stories.title: Show HN: Delayed Send for Microsoft Teams

stories.text:
Hi!

Was wondering if anyone has changed careers from tech (dev, engineering, mgmt, IT, etc)

Been doing this (web dev) for 5+ yrs and relatively successful. I believe in trying everything and so just becoming "a better tech person" for 40+ yrs doesn't quite sit well with me. I have an MS in Comp Eng btw, just kinda more than burnt out and fed up with tech.

I'm open into discovering more opportunities with the Arts and Business, etc.

However, I acknowledge the pay prob won't be nearly as much as what I could make in a traditional tech career trajectory..

What were your insights recommendations, etc.?
stories.title: Career Change from Tech
